channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023100759
item.description:
Report E-2023100759

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged five (5) gallon drum and placed it in a drum for disposal. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the impacted area. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023100776
item.description:
Report E-2023100776

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: ANN ARBOR
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4 liters of Tetrahydrofuran were released from (1) 4-liter glass jar due to unknown causes. The release impacted the cardboard container. The spill was cleaned by terminal personnel and (1) 5 gallon DF contains glass, cardboard absorbed product was created as waste. The waste was staged and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100761
item.description:
Report E-2023100761

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: ANN ARBOR
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4 oz of Homax (UN1950) wall texture released from a can due to improper loading. The release impacted the concrete. Terminal personnel cleaned the concrete with oil dri and put the impacted materials and PPE into a 20 gallon poly drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023091052
item.description:
Report X-2023091052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was coded as damaged by P&D driver and was found on van with granules spilling out of box. Package was removed from the vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE, where it was discovered that bottom of drum became cracked, causing contents to spill out. DescribePack: Roughly 6" crack on bottom of jug, causing contents to spill out bottom DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from the vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE. Vehicle was swept out and extra granules consolidated with rest of package.
